comment.author: 22948027@N02
comment._content:
The text in Norwegian reads, top: "Panorama av Husvik Harbour - oct fra W" - Panorama of Husvik Harbour, Oct, from the west". 
It is indeed Husvik, not Húsvik - what looks like a diacritical mark is a peculiarity of early 20th century (Scandinavian?) longhand for the letter "u".
Third picture: "Fugleperspektiv av Husvik Hr oct fra W" - bird's-eye perspective of Husvik Harbour, October, from the West.
4th: "Utsigt fra 'Elefant....'" - Vista of 'Elefant...". What the geographical notation is about and what it is called exactly is difficult to see in this low resolution. It might be a glacier, in which case the Norwegian should read 'Elefantbreen'.
